metadata.title: CVE-2020-5253 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
NetHack before version 3.6.0 allowed malicious use of escaping ofcharacters in the configuration file (usually .nethackrc) which could beexploited. This bug is patched in NetHack 3.6.0.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-5253` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

nethack-common - 3.6.0-4
nethack-console - 3.6.0-4
nethack-lisp - 3.6.0-4
nethack-x11 - 3.6.0-4
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: nethack package in esm-apps/focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.6.0-4').
